basics.name: Amirsina Torfi
basics.label: Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Accomplished Machine Learning Engineer specializing in Generative AI, NLP, and Computer Vision with over 8 years of experience in the field, including roles at Meta, Nike, and Huma AI.

work.name: Nike
work.position: Lead Machine Learning Engineer - Tech Lead
work.summary: Directing the development of advanced machine learning systems to revolutionize personalized consumer experiences, accelerate generative design processes, and enable precise human motion tracking. Focused on integrating AI into Nike's design, testing, and consumer engagement initiatives to drive innovation and optimize operational efficiency.
highlights: Reduced prototyping time by 50% by developing generative AI models utilizing GANs, Diffusion Models, and Neural Style Transfer, empowering designers to quickly create and iterate on innovative product concepts aligned with brand aesthetics and consumer preferences.

Led the engineering of multi-view 3D reconstruction pipelines using voxel-based autoencoders, Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), and point cloud processing, enabling the creation of high-fidelity digital twins for virtual try-ons and precise 3D product modeling.

Developed and deployed Vision Transformer (ViT) networks for accurate real-time segmentation, detection, and classification of apparel and footwear in retail environments, reducing out-of-stock occurrences by 20% through effective inventory tracking.

Pioneered human motion tracking and pose estimation models using 3D convolutional networks, optical flow, and temporal attention mechanisms, enhancing athlete product testing and biomechanics analysis to optimize footwear ergonomics and performance.

Implemented AI-driven personalization systems combining generative AI and recommendation algorithms, enabling on-demand generation of personalized footwear designs based on individual style and fit preferences using large-scale, multi-modal consumer datasets.

Optimized cross-functional collaboration by aligning machine learning research with design and consumer insights teams, ensuring AI solutions are both technically robust and strategically aligned with consumer experience goals.

work.name: Meta (Facebook)
work.summary: Led cutting-edge AI research and development, focusing on the integration of NLP, Computer Vision, and Generative AI to drive advancements in consumer engagement and content personalization. Directed end-to-end initiatives from conceptualization through deployment, consistently enhancing computational efficiency and accuracy across Meta's digital platforms.
highlights: Developed advanced Vision Transformer (ViT) and SWIN Transformer models, enhancing semantic segmentation accuracy by 7% and achieving a 15% improvement in user engagement metrics.

Successfully deployed Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems using Large Language Models (LLMs), significantly improving query relevance and enhancing user satisfaction across various applications.

Increased computational efficiency threefold by implementing techniques like mixed-precision training and model quantization, contributing to a 33% increase in revenue by reducing computational costs and accelerating processing times.
Engineered cross-modal AI systems that seamlessly combined NLP and Computer Vision, advancing Visual Question Answering (VQA) and Image Captioning to enhance multi-modal user interactions.

Spearheaded the deployment of generative AI models for personalized content generation, leveraging diffusion models and transformer-based architectures to elevate user experience across Metaâ€™s platforms.
Optimized model deployment with TorchScript and ONNX, ensuring adaptability and performance across diverse hardware environments while reducing latency in real-time applications.
Built robust data pipelines and managed large-scale data analytics with SQL and BigQuery, directly enhancing data-driven decision-making and model training efficiency.

work.name: Huma AI
work.summary: Specialized in developing and optimizing automated Q&A systems powered by large language models (LLMs) to drive revenue growth and operational efficiency. Led initiatives that leveraged cutting-edge NLP techniques to deliver accurate, responsive answers and streamline workflows, contributing to substantial cost savings and enhanced user experience.
highlights: Increased answer accuracy by 20% and reduced response latency by 40% by deploying advanced zero-shot learning techniques and clustering methods, significantly improving system responsiveness and accuracy for a diverse range of user queries.

Engineered end-to-end data flow optimizations for the Q&A system, reducing manual labeling costs by 70% through efficient data utilization and automation strategies, resulting in substantial operational cost savings.
Led the integration of AWS services, including SageMaker, for scalable deployment of the Q&A models, enabling reliable and high-performance model management across production environments.

Contributed over $1M in annual revenue through strategic enhancements in model accuracy and system reliability, optimizing the user experience and establishing the Q&A system as a revenue-generating asset for the organization.

Utilized advanced natural language processing frameworks and tools (e.g., Hugging Face, LangChain) to build robust NLP pipelines, improving both model training efficiency and the overall responsiveness of the Q&A system.
